metadata.title: CVE-2022-48565 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
An XML External Entity (XXE) issue was discovered in Python through 3.9.1.The plistlib module no longer accepts entity declarations in XML plistfiles to avoid XML vulnerabilities.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc2-1
libpython3.11 - 3.11.0~rc2-1
libpython3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc2-1
libpython3.11-stdlib - 3.11.0~rc2-1
libpython3.11-testsuite - 3.11.0~rc2-1
python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc2-1
python3.11-examples - 3.11.0~rc2-1
python3.11-full - 3.11.0~rc2-1
python3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc2-1
python3.11-nopie - 3.11.0~rc2-1
python3.11-venv - 3.11.0~rc2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.11 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0~rc2-1').
